canonical_explanation.text: Mean (average) is the sum of all values divided by the number of values. Median is the middle value when data is arranged in order. Mode is the value that appears most frequently. These are measures of central tendency — they help describe the 'centre' of a data set.
rules: Mean = Sum of all values ÷ Number of values
To find the median: arrange values in order, pick the middle one
For an odd number of values, the median is the exact middle value
Mode = the value that occurs most often
A data set can have more than one mode (bimodal) or no mode
Mean, median, and mode can be different for the same data

questions.question_text: The mean (average) of 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 is:
Mean is also called the:
questions.explanation_correct: Mean and average are the same thing.

questions.question_text: The average of 10, 20, 30 is:
The median of 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 is:
questions.explanation_correct: Data is already in order. 5 values, so median is the 3rd (middle) value = 7.

questions.question_text: The mode of 2, 3, 3, 5, 7, 3, 8 is:
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3 appears most often (3 times). Mode = most frequent value.

questions.question_text: Ravi scored 85, 90, 78, 92, 80 in 5 tests. His average score is:
The median of 12, 5, 8, 3, 10 is:

questions.explanation_correct: 7 appears 3 times, 8 appears 2 times, others appear once. Mode = 7 (most frequent).

questions.question_text: The average of 5 numbers is 12. The sum of the 5 numbers is:
questions.explanation_correct: Mean = Sum ÷ Count. So Sum = Mean × Count = 12 × 5 = 60.

questions.question_text: The mean of 15, 25, 35 is ___
To find the median, you must first arrange the data in order.
questions.explanation_correct: The median is the middle value in ordered data. You must sort the data first.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Median requires data to be arranged in ascending or descending order.

questions.question_text: Mode is the value that appears:
questions.explanation_correct: Mode = the most frequently occurring value in a data set.

questions.question_text: 4 students weigh 30 kg, 35 kg, 40 kg, and 45 kg. Their average weight:
Data: 4, 5, 5, 6, 6, 6, 7, 8. The mode is:
questions.explanation_correct: 6 appears 3 times (most frequent). 5 appears twice. Others appear once.

questions.question_text: The average marks of a student in 4 subjects are 75. If she scored 80, 70, and 65 in three subjects, her score in the 4th subject is:
The median of 9 values arranged in order is the:
questions.explanation_incorrect: For n values (odd), median is at position (n+1)/2 = (9+1)/2 = 5th.

questions.question_text: Data: 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. The mode is:
questions.explanation_correct: Each value appears exactly once. No value is more frequent than others, so there is no mode.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All values appear once — no value occurs most often. No mode.

questions.question_text: The formula for mean is:
questions.explanation_correct: Mean = Sum of all values ÷ Number of values.

questions.question_text: The average of 3, 7, and x is 5. The value of x is:
The median of 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13 is ___
A data set can have two modes.
questions.explanation_correct: If two values both appear with the highest frequency, the data is bimodal (has two modes).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Data with two equally frequent values is called bimodal.

questions.question_text: The average temperature for 7 days was 32°C. The total temperature for all 7 days:
Heights of 5 plants: 12 cm, 8 cm, 15 cm, 10 cm, 6 cm. The median height:
Shoe sizes of 10 students: 5, 6, 5, 7, 6, 5, 8, 5, 6, 7. The mode is:
questions.explanation_correct: 5 appears 4 times, 6 appears 3 times, 7 appears 2 times, 8 appears 1 time. Mode = 5.

questions.question_text: Priya's marks: 88, 76, 94, 82, 90. Her average is:
If the mean of 6 numbers is 10, and one more number (17) is added, what is the new mean?
questions.explanation_correct: Old sum = 6 × 10 = 60. New sum = 60 + 17 = 77. New mean = 77 ÷ 7 = 11.

questions.question_text: The mode of 4, 4, 4, 5, 5, 6 is ___
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 occurs 3 times, more than any other value. Mode = 4.

questions.question_text: The mean of a data set is always one of the values in the data set.
questions.explanation_correct: The mean can be a value not in the data. For example, mean of 3, 4, 5 = 4 (in data), but mean of 1, 2, 6 = 3 (not in data).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mean can be a value not present in the data set.

questions.question_text: The average of 5, 5, 5, 5, 5 is:
questions.explanation_correct: Sum = 25. Mean = 25 ÷ 5 = 5. (When all values are the same, the mean equals that value.)
questions.explanation_incorrect: When all values are equal, mean = that value = 5.

questions.question_text: Ages of 7 children: 8, 10, 12, 9, 11, 7, 13. The median age:
Data: 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5. This data has:
questions.explanation_correct: 3 appears twice and 4 appears twice — both have the highest frequency. The data is bimodal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3 and 4 both appear twice (more than others). Two modes = bimodal.

questions.question_text: A cricket player scored 30, 50, 40, 60, 20 in 5 matches. His average is:
The median is always the same as the mean.
questions.explanation_correct: Mean and median can be different. For example: 1, 2, 100. Mean = 34.33, Median = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mean and median are often different, especially in skewed data.

questions.question_text: The mode of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 is:
questions.explanation_correct: Each number appears exactly once. No value is more frequent, so there is no mode.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All appear once. No most-frequent value. No mode.

questions.question_text: To get an average of 80 in 5 subjects, and having scored 75, 82, 90, 68, how much must the student score in the 5th subject?
questions.explanation_correct: Total needed = 80 × 5 = 400. Scored so far = 75+82+90+68 = 315. 5th subject = 400-315 = 85.

questions.question_text: The average of the first 5 natural numbers (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) is:
In a survey, favourite colour chosen: Red-8, Blue-8, Green-5, Yellow-3. The mode is:
questions.explanation_correct: Red and Blue both have frequency 8 (the highest). Both are modes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red (8) and Blue (8) are tied for highest frequency. Both are modes.

questions.question_text: If all values in a data set are the same, the mean equals that value.
questions.explanation_correct: If all values = k, then sum = n×k, mean = n×k/n = k.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All same values → mean = that same value.

questions.question_text: Which measure of central tendency is NOT affected by extreme values?
questions.explanation_correct: The median is not affected by extreme values because it depends only on the middle position. The mean is affected because it uses all values.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Median depends on position, not value magnitude. Mean uses all values, so extremes pull it.

questions.question_text: The average height of 3 friends is 140 cm. If two friends are 135 cm and 145 cm tall, the third is:
Daily ice cream sales: 20, 25, 30, 25, 35, 25, 40. The mode sales:
The mean of 8 numbers is 15. If one number is removed and the mean becomes 14, the removed number was:
Median means the ___ value in ordered data.
questions.explanation_correct: Median = middle value when data is arranged in order.

questions.question_text: The mode is always a number that appears in the data set.
questions.explanation_correct: Unlike the mean, the mode must be an actual value from the data set (the most frequently occurring one).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mode is always a value present in the data.

questions.question_text: The median of 5, 10, 15 is the same as the mean. Both are:
The average daily rainfall for a week is 5 mm. What total rainfall fell that week?
